problem_text:
Describe the finite groups in which every proper subgroup has a complement in some larger subgroup. Among these groups are, for example, PSL2(7) and all Sylow subgroups of symmetric groups.
V. M. Levchuk
answer: These groups are described independently in (V. M. Levchuk, A. G. Likharev, Siberian Math. J., 47, no. 4 (2006), 659–668) and in (V. N. Tyutyanov, Proc. Gomel’ State Univ., 3 (2006), 178–183 (in Russian)).
